availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Leander M. Cox (Fleming County, Kentucky, attorney and politician)

body.p: Fleming County, Kentucky, attorney and politician. Virginia native. Married to Emily Thompson Cox in Mason County, Kentucky, on September 18, 1838. Married to Margaret P. Cox. Father of Nannie B. Cox, Andrew T. Cox, and Thomas H. Cox. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Fleming County from 1843 to 1845. Attorney in Fleming County in 1850. Presidential elector for the Whig Party from the 9th District of Kentucky in 1852. Member of the U.S. House of Representatives from Kentucky from 1853 to March 4, 1857. Attorney in Fleming County in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Fleming County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
